results.snippet: MOSCOW, Monday, Aug. 7 -- A Soviet space ship that carried the second Russian astronaut landed safely today after having orbited the earth more than seventeen times in 25 hours and 18 minutes. The five-ton satellite piloted by Maj. Gherman S. Titov...

byline.original: By SEYMOUR TOPPING Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Monday, Aug. 7 -- A Soviet space ship that carried the second Russian astronaut landed safely today after having orbited the earth more than seventeen times in 25 hours and 18 minutes. The five-ton satellite piloted by Maj. Gherman S. Titov was returned to earth on command from the Soviet space center during its eighteenth revolution of the earth, the Moscow radio reported.

results.snippet: It is really no good looking at the word "negotiation" as an incantation that can be repeated and will solve everything. If from the start there is no hope of getting an agreement, it is worse than no negotiation at all. Therefore the problem wants...
results.lead_paragraph: It is really no good looking at the word "negotiation" as an incantation that can be repeated and will solve everything. If from the start there is no hope of getting an agreement, it is worse than no negotiation at all. Therefore the problem wants looking at extremely carefully to see whether it is profitable to get into a negotiation and if so when.

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug 18 -- The National Aeronautics and Space Administration has decided to omit further suborbital flights. Instead, it will concentrate on an orbit of the earth with a manned vehicle.

results.abstract: Titov repts some oddities of flight caused by weightlessness, Pravda article; repts fruit juice drops floated before him; says he threw logbook in air and photographed it; reveals he was not strapped to couch throughout flight; repts no adverse physical effects

headline.main: TITOV DESCRIBES ODDITIES OF TRIP; Fruit Juice Drops Floated Before Eyes, He Writes

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Aug. 23 -- Maj. Gherman S. Titov had the unusual experience during his recent orbital flight of watching droplets of spilled fruit juice float before his eyes. He also amused himself by taking movies of his logbook hovering overhead in the...

byline.original: By THEODORE SHABAD Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 23 -- Maj. Gherman S. Titov had the unusual experience during his recent orbital flight of watching droplets of spilled fruit juice float before his eyes. He also amused himself by taking movies of his logbook hovering overhead in the cabin of his spaceship Vostok II.

results.abstract: 2 test firings canceled after discovery of loose solder in transistors in auto-pilot-programer

headline.main: SOLDER DELAYED MERCURY FIRING; Dust Is Found in Transistor in Tests Made in West

results.snippet: Dust-like particles of solder caused the cancelation of Project Mercury's unmanned orbital flight Friday morning.
